alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:22PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Weber and northern Davis Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 721 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Hooper, or 14 miles west of Hill Air Force Base, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, a wind gust of 49 mph was reported on Fremont Island. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on the Great Salt Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 331 and 348. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH

area.areaDesc: Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
